Welcome to DAO’s documentation!¶

DAO is a new and open source reflection model for black hole accretion disks.

  • Installation

[1]

T. M. Belloni. States and Transitions in Black Hole Binaries. In Tomaso Belloni, editor, Lecture Notes in Physics, Berlin Springer Verlag, volume 794, pages 53. 2010. doi:10.1007/978-3-540-76937-8_3.

[2]

K. S. Thorne and R. H. Price. Cygnus X-1: an interpretation of the spectrum and its variability. \apjl , 195:L101–L105, February 1975. doi:10.1086/181720.

[3]

R. A. Sunyaev and J. Truemper. Hard X-ray spectrum of CYG X-1. \nat , 279:506–508, June 1979. doi:10.1038/279506a0.

[4]

G. Matt, G. C. Perola, and L. Piro. The iron line and high energy bump as X-ray signatures of cold matter in Seyfert 1 galaxies. \aap , 247:25, July 1991.

[5]

I. D. Novikov and K. S. Thorne. Astrophysics of black holes. In C. DeWitt and B. S. DeWitt, editors, Black Holes (Les Astres Occlus), 343–450. New York, January 1973. Gordon and Breach Science Publishers.

[6]

Adam R. Ingram and Sara E. Motta. A review of quasi-periodic oscillations from black hole X-ray binaries: Observation and theory. \nar , 85:101524, September 2019. arXiv:2001.08758, doi:10.1016/j.newar.2020.101524.

[7]

Honghui Liu, Jiachen Jiang, Zuobin Zhang, Cosimo Bambi, Andrew C. Fabian, Javier A. García, Adam Ingram, Erin Kara, James F. Steiner, John A. Tomsick, Dominic J. Walton, and Andrew J. Young. High-density Reflection Spectroscopy of Black Hole X-Ray Binaries in the Hard State. \apj , 951(2):145, July 2023. arXiv:2303.10593, doi:10.3847/1538-4357/acd8b9.

[8]

R. R. Ross and A. C. Fabian. A comprehensive range of X-ray ionized-reflection models. \mnras , 358(1):211–216, March 2005. arXiv:astro-ph/0501116, doi:10.1111/j.1365-2966.2005.08797.x.

[9]

J. García and T. R. Kallman. X-ray Reflected Spectra from Accretion Disk Models. I. Constant Density Atmospheres. \apj , 718(2):695–706, August 2010. arXiv:1006.0485, doi:10.1088/0004-637X/718/2/695.

[10]

J. García, T. Dauser, C. S. Reynolds, T. R. Kallman, J. E. McClintock, J. Wilms, and W. Eikmann. X-Ray Reflected Spectra from Accretion Disk Models. III. A Complete Grid of Ionized Reflection Calculations. \apj , 768(2):146, May 2013. arXiv:1303.2112, doi:10.1088/0004-637X/768/2/146.

[11]

J. García, T. Dauser, A. Lohfink, T. R. Kallman, J. F. Steiner, J. E. McClintock, L. Brenneman, J. Wilms, W. Eikmann, C. S. Reynolds, and F. Tombesi. Improved Reflection Models of Black Hole Accretion Disks: Treating the Angular Distribution of X-Rays. \apj , 782(2):76, February 2014. arXiv:1312.3231, doi:10.1088/0004-637X/782/2/76.

[12]

T. Kallman, M. Bautista, J. Deprince, J. A. García, C. Mendoza, A. Ogorzalek, P. Palmeri, and P. Quinet. Photoionization Models for High-density Gas. \apj , 908(1):94, February 2021. arXiv:2011.10603, doi:10.3847/1538-4357/abccd6.

[13]

[14]

A. A. Zdziarski, W. N. Johnson, and P. Magdziarz. Broad-band \ensuremath \gamma -ray and X-ray spectra of NGC 4151 and their implications for physical processes and geometry. \mnras , 283(1):193–206, November 1996. arXiv:astro-ph/9607015, doi:10.1093/mnras/283.1.193.

[15]

Lev Titarchuk. Generalized Comptonization Models and Application to the Recent High-Energy Observations. \apj , 434:570, October 1994. doi:10.1086/174760.
